runs.comm: dropped! What drama! Short, and Bell was back into the crease, hurried on the pull, and O'Keeffe at square leg dropped a sitter!
back into the crease and punched tidily into the off side
short, wide, and flogged, high and not-very-handsome over deep cover. Effective
too short, and this time Bell has the measure of Tait's slippery pace, a powerful pull with a roll of the wrists. That fizzes through midwicket
fetch that! Too straight, Bell goes up onto his toes, threads the gap at cover, and doesn't bother to run
a mistimed punch, back to the bowler. Well, it is officially all happening
that is a gorgeous strike. Davies has been in mothballs for two months, but he's clearly been middling them in the nets. A touch of width, and caressed through the covers
ah ... maybe he is a bit rusty after all. A similar delivery, but this one is lifted into the hands of short cover. Lee starts his lawnmower, and Australia have their breakthrough!
outside off, open face, worked into the gully
airily driven, through the gap at cover, but at a catchable height. KP is up and running
inside-out swipe, trickles into the gap at midwicket
short, might have been a slower ball. Helped round the corner to short fine leg
Dropped! Bell survives again, a sliced drive to Warner in the gully, who makes good ground low to his left, but can't cling on...
that was an emphatic follow-up from Bell, out of his crease to blaze through the covers. But he hit the field
lovely use of the feet, as Bell flicks an on-drive down the ground. Just rescued inside the rope by a flick of the hand
right up to the toes, flicked up and over midwicket, one bounce to the man on the fence
down the leg-side. Arguably the least eventful delivery of the innings so far. It's been breathless!
what a shot! Nice catch in the crowd too... short and wide, and violently uppercut, clean over the third man rope!
dabbed out to point
KP wants some of the action now. Out of the crease, and drilled over long-on
a footless mow to a good-length delivery. Inside-edged into the crease, and off they run for a quick single
deflected through the gap in the cordon, good delivery in the circumstances, squared up a touch
pulled hard through midwicket and that's a bad misfield on the boundary's edge. O'Keeffe again. Two touches, two errors
driven hard into the covers
under-edged into the crease, and deflected to fine leg. Paine rushes round to field
outside off, carved down to third man
how did that get there? A massive swipe from Pietersen, ends up at fine leg
down the track, another lofted flog, and this time Smith in the covers does the business. The end of a lively innings from Bell. He's got England up and running
a bit of width, Collingwood pokes out to point
easy for Collingwood, short and too straight, and helped around the corner with a roll of the wrists
fuller length, defended back to the bowler
clobbered, down the track and really lifted up and over long-off
zoinks, that's hit! Down on one knee, and belted into the stands at square leg
three-card trick! Pietersen thought he was in the zone, played one stroke too many, and David Hussey at mid-off timed his leap to perfection to intercept
outside off, left alone judiciously
down the track, clipped to long-on
flicked to midwicket, an excellent recovery in that over
cautious defence to a good-length delivery on off stump. Point fields
down the leg side
stabbed out to midwicket, and they run a quick single
flicked in the air, through the gap at midwicket
punched back down the track, a tidy over so far
punched into the covers
outside off, left alone, suddenly it's all gone very calm out there
tossed onto a good length, flicked back to the bowler
an attempted paddywhack, but that flicks the pad and deflects to short third man
big stride forward and blocked
pushed into the gap at long-on, another single
clipped firmly to midwicket
that's the way to do it, a touch of room to swing the bat, and lofted into space at wide mid-off. A timely boundary
defended back to the bowler
dabbed down into the crease
nice shot from Colly, too full from Johnson, and he put the full face of the blade behind a bottom-handed clump over long-on
poked out to point
outside off
short and wide, and might have been called had Morgan not made contact with a wafty cut
huge appeal, but that was ambitious. Collingwood was way down, and struck outside off. A run-out attempt might have been closer though!
pumped to long-on
very straight, and Morgan jabs an uneasy cut through backward point
a touch of width, driven calmly to deep cover. Singles will suffice for the moment, it seems
another drive, beats the infield and collected in the deep. Sharp running brings two
watchful defence on off stump
cramped cut straight to point
full and straight, and jabbed to point
slow bouncer, Morgan can't make contact
That. Is. Huge. Short, and Morgan swings into a vicious pull, clears the square leg boundary and bounces off the hospitality railings!
fuller this time, and Morgan is waiting. A lofted drive, one bounce over long-off!
low full toss, biffed back down the track, and hits the non-striker's stumps right at the base! Collingwood was lucky there were no Lee fingertips on that
tweaking from off to leg, helped round the corner
round the wicket, big angles involved there. Morgan steps back and guides a punch into the gap at cover
on the pads from over the wicket to the right-hander. Clipped square
Morgan tries to work with the angle, but nearly gets a leading edge. Canny bowling
reverse-sweep, and that's due reward for a fine over. A big top-edge from Collingwood, and Paine walks round to gather
aggressive intent. A firm drive, straight to cover
good ball, pitches on middle-and-leg and Morgan is beaten outside off
you can't bowl there, short and pulled behind square
clipped to mid-on
that was exceptionally plumb! For a moment it looked as though Wright had got a tickle of bat on a leg-glance, but nope, it was pad all the way
an ambitious dive on the long-on boundary from Johnson, a long delay but the third umpire decrees he was touching the rope
drilled into the covers, Bresnan keeps the strike
well flighted, driven to short cover, and intercepted
driven out to deep extra cover
another brilliant shot made to look effortless from Morgan, an inside-out drive over wide mid-off
too short, and pulled hard and flat through midwicket
a jabbed single, and all of a sudden the rate is all but a run a ball
crashed into the covers, but well fielded
on the toes, can't get the flick away
outside off, steered down to third man
too straight, swinging to leg, and flicked hard towards the square leg boundary, where two men tidy up between them
on the pads again, very full
too much width, too much even for Morgan to time his cut. Deep cover collects
lovely strike from Bresnan, on the toes and clipped firmly towards the midwicket boundary. A leaky over from Johnson and England are right on top now
driven firmly to mid-off, and another instant single
well, well, that's a timely breakthrough! The rate is already a run a ball, but England's finisher falls to a tame drive to short cover ...
blimey! Two in two! A surprise bouncer to Yardy, he tried not to play it but his bat grazed the ball periscope style as he swayed out of line!
good delivery, angled in from outside off. Defended from deep in the crease
driven out to point, and that is Woakes' first international run
sturdy defence on off stump, and suddenly Adelaide is abuzz.
good delivery, angled in from wide on the crease. Woakes can only defend
well, that will help! Banged in short, and Woakes is onto it in a flash, pulled high and handsome into the midwicket stands!
back on a full length, deflected down to third man
attempted swish, ends up dead in the crease, but Woakes makes a sharp call. Another single stolen
poked out to point, Smith steadied himself for a shy at the non-striker's end, but missed. That was gone for all money!
outside off, an air-shot, and the rate is back over a run a ball. Just ...
smacked to mid-on, another single to the cause
slower ball, dabbed to third man
outside off, swished over the covers, but there's not enough bat on that, and Bresnan falls! Now this will test the mettle of England's tail
poked down to third man
jabbed to third man, another sprightly single. Though another direct hit would have been out ...
slower ball, hops over the top of a loose cut. A fine over, and Australia are right back in the mix ... and more!
thigh-high full-toss, but Swann is surprised by that and can't get it away
driven hard into the covers, but that's just a single as the cover fielder tidies up
another drive, elegant stroke, but the field is well set for Swann's off-side repertoire. Another single
that's vital. A loose delivery, another full toss, and this time Woakes was onto it, cut hard through point
cut hard, straight down into the crease. So nearly chopped on, but it's another single as Lee attempts a two-footed tackle on the in-rushing Swann!
clever work from Swann. All the field on the off-side, so he paddles an off-side delivery out towards deep square leg. It's England's to lose now ...
that's the way to lose it! Swann went for glory, with a hoist through the leg-side, but he's bowled middle stump!
excellent delivery, a cutter, and Shahzad looks for the single but it's not there
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
he's off the strike, first job done. A cutter again, deflects off the thigh pad out to gully
cracking stroke! Firmly carved out to deep point, they rush back for two, and the scores are tied
up to the pads, swished up and over midwicket, that's the winning run, and welcome to international cricket, Chris Woakes. He looks the part, on that showing
